website_summaries.verdict: A mummy-style sleeping bag that is lightweight and warm and comes with an industry-leading warranty.
pros: Although rated for 40 degrees, this sleeping bag can also be used in temperatures as low as 29 degrees thanks in part to the fleece lining and water-resistant exterior
Includes a hood and carrying bag, and comes with a lifetime warranty
cons: Longevity of the stitching is questionable
A bit pricier than some competitors

customer_reviews.title: OutdoorsmanLab Ultralight Mummy @ Jacks River Falls, Cohutta GA in Frosty FEB
customer_reviews.text: I have a more expensive 0 bag I use when it is below 20 degrees however I needed a very quick ultralight solution that was not only cost effective but available to deliver within 2 days to my house. I inquired about a few details on this pack and the company was very responsive with 2-3 emails over 24 hour. I'm 6'2 195 lbs and loved the extra length and room up top - GREAT SIZING! This bag worked very well in 25-30 degree weather even with 20-25 mph wind gusts. I did have an underquilt however I feel it would support the temps described in the ad easily. See photo of my personal setup using this bag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Sleeping Bag I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Fast delivery! Seller is quick to respond. The 2 man sleeping bag comfortably sleeps two. Could sleep three if needed. High quality materials. I'm 6 foot and can pull the top of the bag over my head with my wife inside, so it's pretty damn big! Our cat loves it, too. Definitely would buy again from them!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: I bought both blue and orange to zip together for quick camping trips. I've been hiking/guiding/mountain climbing for nearly 20 years, tried everything from the best to the worst. This is just above some of worst, below average- hence 2 stars. Zippers very low quality, don't stay zipped, Velcro wasn't thought out on location, stitching is questionable if it'll last longer than a couple light camping trips, low quality materials. If you don't camp often, just need something cheap for a yearly trip, these should be great for you! For the money there are better options of zip together bags though.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart at the seams-seller replaced promptly
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these sleeping bags. Four of them are still great, but one of the bags is falling apart in multiple places at the seams. It must have been a poor sewing job. *EDIT* The seller replaced the sleeping bag promptly. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Andre F.

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: I feel kind of bad giving a negative review on this bag; it seems like the designers tried their best, but I just don't like it. I have sensory processing issues and I really hate the feel of certain fabrics and the fabric lining this bag was just awful. This issue could be fixed by using a bag liner. However, I also felt that the fabric did not breathe at all, so it was a bit like sleeping in a plastic bag - and venting the side didn't help. On the pro side: great price, kept me warm down to around 60 F, light weight and compact, can be paired to make a double, nice design features (pocket, straps).
customer_reviews.author: lemonhead

customer_reviews.title: And you CAN get it all back in the bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic bag. I use it with a Coleman blow up bed, that were purchased earlier. This has nice elastic, full width loops, in which to retain blow up items, that you wish to sleep on, no matter what they may look like to others. Normal people would use air mattresses, I have admitted to liking a certain air bed. There are other people out there, and what they use, is, well, I hope it is at least an informed use. This bag has kept me comfortably warm, down to about 40. That is when Princess wasn't hogging "Our" share.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: 5 STARS FOR THIS SLEEPING BAG
customer_reviews.text: Love this sleeping bag. The fact that it goes from being one huge sleeping bag to two 1 person sleeping bag is the best feature. The texture of this product is high end and I was not disappointed when I took it out camping in 38 degrees I stayed warm and so did my wife and son
customer_reviews.author: Abi Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect summer bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect for southern summer nights. The only drawback is the size for me. I'm 5'11" and about 190 pounds. The bag was very tight, kind of resembled a mummy bag when I zipped it all the way. If they made a bag that was 3-4 inches wider I would have nothing bad to say. I managed by not zipping it all the way... It was to hot outside anyways. I highly recommend this bag for summer camping. The pillow pouch also worked great with a towel stuffed inside for a pillow. The elastic straps also held it on my 4 inch thick sleeping pad without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! This sleeping bag is very comfortable and very light! It’s 2 sleeping bags and when rolled up it’s smaller than one sleeping bag rolled up! My girlfriend and I used this on a camping trip and loved it! The material is excellent! It’s not that sticky polyester that sucks when it’s hot! It breathes well! We used it in a 65 degree Michigan summer night for sleeping and were very comfortable! Even in the morning when you usually are super hot in tents we were very comfortable inside the bag! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Wenk

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, warm and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED: Seller immediately got in touch and I have just received a replacement sleeping bag. 5 stars for the excellent customer service and the light and warm sleeping bag! ______________ The sleeping bag is lightweight and warm... but on my first and only use of it (camping in my car, not rough environment or anything...), the seams and fabric around the hood drawstring area tore. Unsure if or how to fix. I understand that at a low price like this you get what you pay for, but not even ONE use without it breaking? Disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: VD

customer_reviews.title: Ive never had a worst nights sleep
customer_reviews.text: I am not a big person by any means and this sleeping bag felt like a coffin! I could not get comfortable and I was on top of a sleeping pad. I was very cold as well and we are in florida and it really wasnt that cold of a night. Also for the love of all things I cannot get it back into the bag it came in. It was very difficult to get out of that bag as well and normally I'm good at repacking things. I wish I could return it but I can't. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful product. It's light yet kept me nice and ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. It's light yet kept me nice and warm in around 28 degree weather at night:) Just remember...your buying a mummy bag and if you are use to using regular sleeping bags or haven't used a mummy bag(like me) for 20 plus years it took a night to get use to. Once I did though I love this thing. I had no problem putting back into its original bag. I recommend this if you need to pack light and small for either backpacking or like I did Camp and Ride. I have a 2007 Harley Davidson Sportster. Have fun!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for Big and Tall
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'6" and 250# and I barely fit in this bag. It is a very tight fit and I will probably save it for one of my younger brothers. I was also dismayed that it is larger stuffed in its bag than described. It is 4.2 pounds and about the size of most other bags on the market. I was looking for a bag to use backpacking, but this one is a bit too large for such an enterprise.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Felt Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This bag was a joke from the beginning. Upon opening it the carrying bag split at the seam. I was leaving for vacation the next day so I decided to try it anyway. The material was cheap, the zippers made a ton of noise and it didn't breathe well at all. Save your money, skip the cheapo and buy a nice sleeping bag. It's well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy
customer_reviews.text: Nice double bag, soft and warm. Love the shiny blue color and cozy liner. Pillows well not so big or fluffy but an extra so .. I'm happy with this purchase. I'd like it better though if the bag had a tie or strap to hold its shape before stuffing it back in the tight bag. Luckily I had a strap so it works fine now ..
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the sleeping bag! The material is really soft on the inside- Its quality and it's a great size for two people. My husband and I just went camping and we were so happy we bought this. It's light weight to travel with and it fits easily in the carry bag. And it's great that the sleeping bag splits into two if needed- we didn't do it though. My only "complaint" would be that the "pillows" are tiny and more suitable for baby dolls but it wasn't really a big deal- the pillows were an added bonus and not at all why we chose this sleeping bag. I cant say enough great things! I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy B

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: Very nice light-weight sleeping bag. I am able to stuff some extra personal belongings into the sack (my reading book, glasses case, extra socks) which is nice. I camped in the Colorado mountains with this bag this past August and the nights were a bit chilly. I got a cheap, soft blanket from a Walmart and first wrapped myself in the blanket and then curled up inside the bag bag. Very warm! Bring a sweatshirt and hat to cover your head, too.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly warm
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really sure of the rating on this lightweight bag but, for my needs, it was perfect. I spent two weeks in a trailer and my bedding was this bag. The temps weren't too cold but I definitely felt a chill when I wasn't in the bag. So, I can't really rate it for camping in a tent in very clod weather, but it worked very well for me. It is lightweight and very compact. One always wonders if an item can be put back into the carrying case but, though not as neatly as on purchase, I was able to fit the bag back into its carrying sleeve with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kasal

customer_reviews.title: Great sack
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag reminds me spot of the bivey sack I had in the army, but more light weight. I got this bag to try on my trip to the Sierra Nevada's, but so far it's done 2 night in the smokies at about 38 degrees and I've slept like a baby each night. Takes about as much room as my camping hammock does and weights about the same also. Very happy with this sack so far.
customer_reviews.author: D. C.

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, soft, strong materials. Not particularly packable, but for the money I'd say that you're unlikely to find a sleeping bag that does so any better. I'm allergic to down, so synthetics are what I have to go with, and I think that this bag will be quite comfortable to sleep in. I'll have to test it out before I'll know for sure. My only knock is that at 6'2" it's not as roomy, length wise as I might like, but it is JUST long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Molnar

customer_reviews.title: Just not that good
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this sleeping bag and wanted to keep this sleeping bag. Even considered gifting it to me kid, but that would have made me a horrible parent. Its about as thick as an old motel bed spread and not very warm. It rendered my inflated sleeping pad useless. The width is pathetic and this is from a 5'3", 157 lb female with sorta broad shoulders. It was a struggle to zip up and even roll over. I wanted light but to sacrifice comfort changed my mind. I returned this and went with wider model, that's thicker, heavier but hopefully more comfortable. I've learned that I'm willing take a couple extra pounds for a decent nights sleep.
customer_reviews.author: T. MCCLARY

customer_reviews.title: Excellent size and weight for motorcycle camping!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a light and compact sleeping bag for motorcycle camping. This is it! Just got it so I can't speak to warmth or durability, but it unpacks and packs back up in stuff sack easily. Exactly what I wanted. Fits readily horizontally or vertically in the aluminum panniers on my R1200GS. Got the Outdoorsman Ultralight sleeping pad as well and the straps on the bag should keep the two together.
customer_reviews.author: So Cal Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not a "comfort" rating but I like it.
customer_reviews.text: 29 deg is definitely a "survival" rating. Some reasonably warm clothes and a bag liner and I was comfortable in the high 20's though. I like the fact that when it's warm i can stick my feet out. That makes a huge difference. Also nice when my feet are nasty. Let's face it, if you're in a sleeping bag there's a good chance the situation comes with stinky feet. Also, I was surprised at the quality of the compression sack. Usually that and zippers are the first failures in less expensive bags. Zipper seems reasonable as well.
customer_reviews.author: F. Howe

customer_reviews.title: A Great Beginner Backpacking Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend because we were starting to do more backpacking and she was using a giant sleeping bag that we had used for car camping. The sleeping bag in its compression sack took up the majority of her hiking backpack before and now, it takes up about the size of a Nalgene bottle. She can finally split some of the weight of the equipment we bring along! My girlfriend said it was both comfy, warm, and didn't slide around too much with the included straps on the backside of the sleeping bag. I highly recommend for a budget beginner backpacking bag!
customer_reviews.author: BSUNG

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a little narrow
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag was super tiny, which was amazing for backpacking. It's hard to get out of the little bag it comes in, but it goes back in pretty easy. Relatively comfortable, but it is kind of narrow. It was hard to move inside the bag. It was also a bit chilly. It was down to the high 50's on the trip I took it on, and I was definitely wanting another blanket. If you're camping in a super warm area, it might be ok, but in the upper mid-west in early June, it was not quite warm enough. I will be keeping this for one of my kiddos, but it's kind of small for an adult bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations, however...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. That's all I have to say. This sleeping bag easily exceeded my expectations. If you're shivering outside your tent, this sleeping bag will NOT keep you warm inside the tent - all else (e.g. clothing) equal. That's an over-generalization, sure. However, I think that's a fair guideline to go off of for this sleeping bag. The absolute best quality of this sleeping bag is that it compresses to roughly 1/4 the size of my previous Coleman sleeping bag... For just-above-cold conditions, when your trip involves hiking with a backpack, this sleeping bag is absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality, beware of width
customer_reviews.text: This zips on your right if you're in it. I prefer my left like other bags I've had. I use it indoors and it kept me warm while other, thicker bags required a blanket. Nice and light weight for traveling but difficult to put in and take out of the included carry bag. Built in pocket doesn't zip closed. It has velcro, no zipper. I am 5' 7", 135 lbs. and it's long enough, but not very wide. It feels snug. I think it's best for people under 160 lbs. Unless you want a mummy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper310

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, fairly warm, cheap stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: This back should probably only be used at temperatures as low as 40*F, any lower it it probably wouldn't be comfortable. It is a fairly lightweight back and packs down well but the stuff sack is ridiculously cheap and felt like the straps would tear off quickly. Could be fine for light use, but probably not suited for backpacking. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Morlan

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect! It was lightweight and kept me completely comfortable ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag for a retreat that required us to sleep in open cabins. It was perfect! It was lightweight and kept me completely comfortable during the chilly nights. The price was AWESOME compared to other sleeping bags with similar qualities and the value didn't get lost by the low price. I love that it has the additional head piece and that it was nice and easy to squeeze back in the carrying bag. The only thing I wish was that I could wash it in the washing machine but overall that is a small price to pay. I would highly recommend this bag and I will definitely buy more for the rest of my family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice light summer bag
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I needed light weight bags for our trip to South Africa. These bags are light weight and are good for the 50 degree night temperature we are expecting. For the price the quality is very good. Nice to have the compression sack. Lot of negative comments on the compression sack but they work well for the bag and I have no problem with them. I like the elastic straps on the back to keep the sleeping pad in place. All in all a great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: John V

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last - don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product as a good sleeping bag for our kids. On second use the entire seem ripped. I’m super disappointed. According to Amazon I can’t return it even though we hav had it just over a month. I was hoping this would last our kids a little while for our camping trips, but apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: The best part about this sleeping bag is how compact and ...
customer_reviews.text: It works mainly just as described. I took it for a camping trip where the temperature dropped to the 40s-50s and I was freezing! The best part about this sleeping bag is how compact and light it is. But you don't get any warmth out of it. I am 5'11" , 195 lbs and the sleeping bag went up to my shoulders when I was in it. The pillow case would have been a great addition but the sleeping bag has to be lying completely flat in that position or else it will move around. There wasn't a ton of room to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: This sleeping bag is perfect for those summer night in the mountains where it ...
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is perfect for those summer night in the mountains where it dips into the upper 50s. I used it in my hammock and on the ground with a foam pad. Despite being on a hill, it did not slide very much. The zippers work great! The fabric stood up to some abuse. My only complaint was that the tips of the black bands intended to hold the bag onto a pad were not sealed and began to fray...but this did not affect performance and was easily remedied with clear nail polish or heat.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag for Burning Man
customer_reviews.text: I bought this roomy, long sleeping bag for Burning Man. In the past 9 years, the middle of the night temperature at Burning Man (4,000 feet elevation, 140 miles north of Reno) occasionally goes down to the low 40s and rarely to the high 30s. This year I doubt it ever got much below 50. This sleeping bag was perfect for that weather. Most nights I did not even zip up the bag. I liked the large size, both wide and long, it is a very comfortable bag. Packs up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product numerous times and it is showing mild wear, but still going. I travel alot and pack it in my luggage to use on hotel beds (I don't trust hotel beds). My travel pillow fits in the travel sleeve and I'm good to go. No outdoor use, so I don't know how it would hold up to that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: zipper broke after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these; one for me and one for my 14 year old daughter. They are light weight and comfortable, a little tough to roll back up but I was generally pleased initially. Last weekend I went camping and when I set up our tent with the sleeping bag, i saw that the zipper was pulled apart and there was a hole in the bag itself! Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, though you get what you pay for....
customer_reviews.text: Compared to going to REI or an online lightweight backpacking site, this sleeping bag is very affordable. Pro's: Very light, easy to take backpacking and space-efficient. Con's: In my experience, provides comfort at temperatures more like the 50's - 60's. I've taken it in 30's - 40's temps, though usually need feet warmers or some other aid for nighttime warmth. The stitching also is so-so and started to wear down after about 2 years. If you're new to camping / backpacking and don't have a lot of $ to invest in gear, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Pink

customer_reviews.title: Misleading and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Poor stitching caused a strap to rip off without much effort. You have to struggle to cram the sleeping bag into the sack. The sack is also larger than advertised. The sleeping bag itself is fine, but I bought this product specifically because I need to travel light.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great travel sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is lightweight, it is great for traveling. It has a great carrying bag, is nice and toasty and has straps to keep it from slipping if you are using an air mattress under it. I don't know how it is is insanely cold weather and honestly, I don't want to find out!
customer_reviews.author: Tammyopus

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight compact bag
customer_reviews.text: I like these. Used it a few times. NOT for cold weather, under 50f it would not be good but GREAT for situations ideally over 60 degrees. Super compact and light. ideal for backpacking in good weather or emergency bugout item.... I bought one, used it a few times then bought 3 more. Would totally recommend this if that is what u r looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sleeping bag. We were camping in the Rocky Mountains for about a week. When it got below freezing, I was too cold in it, even with a little blanket lining the bag. Most of the time it did not get so cold. The coldest it's rated for is 35F, and I would say you'd need a blanket to line it at that temp. But 45F and above, I was very comfortable and I really appreciated the zipper system, the cord that you can pull tight to keep your head and shoulders warmer, and the little pocket sewn into the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Galasso

customer_reviews.title: Looks good so far
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a great lightweight temperate weather sleeping bag. I opened it up, played with it, aired it out (although it didn't have a strong smell) and stuffed it back into the sack. Follow their directions...starting with one corner and stuffing it -- don't roll it up -- and it works well. I like the separate zipper on the bottom for my feet. The real test will come later this year when I use it in Northern Thailand for more than a month, but for now it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: CJan

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping bag the Sahara has ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sleeping bag for my trip to Morocco which included an overnight stay in the Sahara. I was thrilled at how compact the bag is for my luggage allowance and amazed at how large it became when I was ready to sleep. I was completely ensconced in my bag, snuggly and warm despite the winter desert night. My driver was so envious of my Outdoorsman bag that I made it a gift to him when our trip ended and he squealed with joy. (I wish I had been recording).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Value Lightweight Bag for Smaller Individuals
customer_reviews.text: I am using it indoors as a lightweight cover/comforter on cool nights (60-65 degrees). It serves that purpose well. It seems well made and is a very good value considering the price. However, I am a small, slender adult male (5' 3") and feel anyone larger would feel cramped in this bag when zipped. I wish it had more room side to side (it measures 29.5 inches). It would be a good choice for a child's lightweight bag in summer. I have not experienced any issues with the zippers so far, unlike others have commented. The two elastic straps on the outside work well to prevent the bag moving around when attached to a sleeping pad (I have an ALPS).
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag with a couple of sleeper (no pun) features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ladyfriend and holy smokes she loves it. The bag has elastic straps going across the back of it at the top and on the bottom. I'm not exactly sure if she uses them as intended, but she puts these straps around her pad to hold her bag in place while she turns at night and she thinks it's just the cat's meow. She also loves the pillow holder/sack. I love the fact that it has such a small footprint in her pack, both size and weight. It allows me to give her more gear!! Truly an excellent, lightweight, warm weather bag.
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight small bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty small but for what it is it's fantastic. 6' and 175lbs is about the max I'd try to fit in it and even that's a little tight. If you're any bigger than that then look elsewhere. It does have some great features though. The built in pillow case and the elastic pad holders are brilliant. It also packs down wonderfully and is really a great lightweight summertime bag.
customer_reviews.author: timsonic

customer_reviews.title: Versatile bag with some extras.
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight bag that can deal with a wide range of temps. Stuff sack is nice to have, but be careful when stuffing it, I tore off one of the straps. It's still usable, but doesn't pack down as tight. Also bought the matching g hald to use as one large unit, really cool option! Some other cool options are pockets for a pillow so it doesn't flop around, elastic straps on the bottom to put a sleeping matt, and a drawstring for the head to keep everything toasty if you want
customer_reviews.author: David Skoog

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Great inexpensive sleeping bag. There were several loose threads here and there, the zipper doesn't always run smooth. But what do you expect from much a cheap bag? I recommend if you are on a budget and just need it for occasional use. Very long, but not for the wide guys. I do like that you can unzip it all the way incase you are a little "wider". Got one in blue and one in orange.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hulstein

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag.stuff sack junk
customer_reviews.text: Well first impression of sleeping bag is good. The only down side to the sleeping bag is zipper will get snagged easily. The stuff sack is junk tried pulling the sleeping bag out when I got it and the stuff sack ripped. I can not get the sleeping bag back into the stuff sack. Stuff sack is very very tight. Took this bag out on a 35 degree and stayed comfortable. I don't think I would go much lower than that.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Henning

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new sleeping bag and needed it to be able to fit inside a dry bag for a kayak in camping trip. I LOVE this bag!! First off, it fits my 5'9" body so well! I broke the zipper out of my last bag since my feet were scrunched in it. That wont be happening with this bag. I love that I can put my travel pillow in the pillow pocket at the top of the bag. The fabric is very comfortable. Its so comfortable!!!! They put a lot of thought into the awesome sleeping bag. Its a great value too!! I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Naughton

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a camping trip my son is going on in November when I got the sleeping bag he immediately jumped right in and asked if he could take it to sleep overs as well. It's a little thin for winter camping if your camping outside but other than that it's great and my son loves it
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: There are better sleeping bags out there...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this thing. It folds up real nice and compact and it's easy to travel with. Unfortunately, the zipper on two of the three sleeping bags we bought broke off while trying to get into them. Also when they say warm weather, they mean it. If that temperature drops in the middle of the night, you're gonna get cold. I would say anything lower than 60° is too cold for this sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: kshamil

customer_reviews.title: Nice features. Too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: The bag has some nice features like the pillowcase and inside pocket. It also does compress to a nice small size because it is small. It's very narrow and would be ok if you only sleep on your back but forget try to turn from one side to the other. I took too long to check it out thoroughly at home and haven't gone on my trip yet but I missed the return date. If you are a petite person or don't mind sleeping in one position, then I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: mammamia

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag
customer_reviews.text: It's very light weight so you don't get hot to fast. Still trying to figure out how to put it back into the bag right so that I don't break the bag, but it is working out for me just fine. It has elastic bands on the back of the bag for holding onto a sleeping mat, but if you actually want to use them then I suggest reinforcing them by sewing them some more because they aren't sown on very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sleeping bag, comfortable and seems well-constructed, no issues with the zippers so far. The only reason I knocked off a star is that I purchased two of these, they fit together but there is an inch and a half difference between the two. It shouldn't bother me so much, but it does. I just wish they really matched.
customer_reviews.author: Annetta Torres

customer_reviews.title: Mummy bag for the win
customer_reviews.text: My son has used this several times, twice at home and three nights camping so far. Our favorite feature is the straps on the back that we put an air mattress in. No more falling off the air bed. It kept him warm when it got down to 45 at night. He says it’s comfortable and slept great.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Packs down a little bulky
customer_reviews.text: I bought this recently and would say overall I’m very pleased! I used it on a backpacking trip in Hawaii so the weather wasn’t that cold, but I was always comfortable. I love the bottom zipper feature where you can extend your feet out of it. It packs down nicely but I feel was a still pretty bulky for trying to travel light. Inside is VERY comfy and has a pouch to put clothes (which I did) or something to use as a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Chico

customer_reviews.title: Seems great now...
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this because I needed a compact sleeping bag for a Mexico Mission (building a house) trip I'm going on in 2 weeks. We have limited space and need everything to fit into 1 duffle bag. So far, so good--it appears to be exactly what I wanted--small, lightweight, compact and looks comfortable. I'll know more once I use it to see if it's warm enough, sturdy and comfortable enough--I'll report back!
customer_reviews.author: D. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Warm and light, roomy too!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the bag for my son as he has outgrown his other sleeping bags at 6'2". He tried the bag out at home and was quite pleased with how comfortable it is for him. It's meant for warmer weather than we currently have locally but it will be perfect for the camping trip we have planned for Florida in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: SewingNerd

customer_reviews.title: Very good bag for teenage boy scouts
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bag, but really tight for an adult. I am 6 feet tall and 210 pounds, and I find this bag is too tight for my frame. My two sons have much slighter frames, and find the bag to be very comfortable, roomy and warm. The bag compresses down small enough to easily fit into a backpack. Overall, highly recommended for teenage boy scouts. Gave it 4 stars because it is too small for an adult man.
customer_reviews.author: A. Stremel

customer_reviews.title: I had no problem doing it and was comfortable trying it out
customer_reviews.text: small packable sleeping bag. I spent very little time opening the bag and after checking it out I was concerned about ever getting it back in the bag. I had no problem doing it and was comfortable trying it out. The zippers worked great with out a problem. I bought a couple of face towels to work as a pillow and the bag has a material holder for a pillow. The pocket is important I can keep things there while sleeping. Not a security question just being able to find things. I plan on using it inside a cabin in the fall and may use it more like a blanket.
customer_reviews.author: David Tredinnick

customer_reviews.title: Designed for smaller people
customer_reviews.text: I like a sleeping bag that has the zipper for the foot box opening, that's a plus! I am 5', 9" and 300lbs., This sleeping bag does not zip closed. I mostly use the his sleeping bag as a blanket anyway. The compression sack, ripped in half after 15 days of Bikepacking. It is warm though.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: spend a little more - get something that is made better. poor construction - loose strings
customer_reviews.text: I'm amending my review because OutdoorsMan Labs sent me a replacement bag, the larger size, and now I fit well in the bag. ---- Prior review: I'm not a big guy (5'8" and 175LBS) and my shoulders don't fit in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary McNamara

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first backpacking sleeping bag, so I don't really have much to compare it to. However, it has served me well on two overnight excursions so far. It's a little cramped, but I think that's by design. When packed up, I was disappointed to find it didn't fit in the sleeping bag compartment of my backpack, but I think that's because my backpack (38L) is a daypack.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Small! Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I want sure if anything that packed down that small could actually be comfortable. It has a decent weight to it, in the sense that you can have that "under the covers" feeling without that "kick the covers off" feeling. I loved mine. My daughter was very pleased, too, saying that previously, she'd been "hot, unzip. Cold, re-zip. Hot, unzip" and therefore waking up uncomfortable many times during the night. These have solved that problem for her, letting her get better night sleep
customer_reviews.author: Joyful Math

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars because the sleeping bag is comfortable and warm. is a pain in the butt to get back in the compression sak, and be careful not to pull the bags straps too hard because they'll break (one of mine did) but considering the price, its reasonable. Also, what kind of sleeping bag isnt hard to get back in the bag. It does fit in the bottom pocket of my Gregory 60l ruck like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jaepend

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag! Lightweight and as advertised. Just received email from one of the owner's of the company inquiring about my experience with this product. Love this personal care and attention. The bag was not quite warm enough for me at 45 degrees but that is the rating, as was suggested by the company owner, an added fleece did the trick. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Best sleeping bag I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I lived for years in a trailer on the desert and used a sleeping bag instead of sheets and blankets. I did the same when I moved to the city. Of all the sleeping bags I've had this is the best--I love it. It's incredibly lightweight and yet has been toasty warm in the cold weather. Zipper is good, good-looking. It's a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Rich

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: For occasional use, these were great and affordable. I think they're rated for 50° and I would agree with that! We backpacked for 5 days and used them zipped together (both orange). We were comfortable until it got down close to that temp. They are lightweight and packed well. We didn't try the pillow pocket, but it's a nice option.
customer_reviews.author: literate farmer

customer_reviews.title: I slept in this and I was perfect all night long
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I purchased this a received it just in time to take camping in NY State. We had warm weather, with night time temps in the high 50s to mid 60s. We sleep on cots so we are off the ground. I slept in this and I was perfect all night long. I usually end up cold at some point in the night and that didn't happen at all with this bag. I love that it packs up so small. I'm 5'6" and I fit the bag well. Someone taller would probably find it a little short. I'm so glad I ordered this.
customer_reviews.author: CCGirl

customer_reviews.title: Fine if you want to replace it every year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag almost exactly 1 year ago. At first I was pleased because it is a pretty warm bag that packed small enough to fit in the sleeping bag compartment of my backpack. One year later, I would estimate 20-25 uses, the seams are coming apart. I have always treated the bag carefully; it has never been washed or dried, if it's not in the stuff sack then it is on my sleeping pad inside my tent. tl;dr It was used gently for 1 year and it is coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: Shane P.

customer_reviews.title: Mine does not pack as small as the photo.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as small as the photo would have you believe. The actual bag is about 2-3 inches bigger all around. Warm to @ 40F. A fleece inside the bag felt perfect when it froze outside the tent. Very light for what you get. Packs ok. There are lighter bags, but this price makes it pretty darn good. I’m keeping it. I also like the foot zipper, but it’s been too cold this winter to use it, maybe perfect in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Lou C

customer_reviews.title: This is a really great warm weather sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great warm weather sleeping bag. I was going camping during the late spring/early summer in the South East, and needed something a little cooler than my other bags. This bag was just warm enough for when it dipped down into the mid 50s at night. If you're looking for a relatively cheap bag, and it's not supposed to get cooler than the mid 50's at night, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. I bought it to have with me while ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. I bought it to have with me while traveling out of the country. I was staying in multiple hotels and wanted a sleeping bag so I didn't have to sleep on the sheets. Thank goodness I purchased because some of the hotels didn't have blankets, so the sleeping bag kept me warm. It's lightweight. I packed it in my checked bag and had no issues with weight
customer_reviews.author: Neisha

customer_reviews.title: Nice sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I gave it four stars because it’s a skinny bag. I am tall slim individual and the bag fit ok, but if you are a bulky build. It could feel tight. It’s comfortable, it kept me warm. Wasn’t a fan of the Velcro near the top pillow area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Zipper broke first time used.
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is very lightweight. Great for tenting above 50 degrees. Used the sleeping bag for the first time this weekend, climbed in and zipped it up, rolled over and the zipper popped apart. Broken, couldn’t put it back together. Cold night. Would recommend buying. Going to throw it away, missed the return window because I bought it this winter for a motorcycle trip in June. My loss.
customer_reviews.author: David Higgins

customer_reviews.title: I'd buy another!
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag was everything I expected. The weight of sleeping bag is perfect for cool nights of camping in our pop-up camper. Bag was easy to put back in the carry sack if you follow seller's instructions which is to start in the corner of the bag and keep pushing it in the carry sack. I'm considering purchasing another.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B

customer_reviews.title: Feet open
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the purchase was light weight but enough to keep you warm and for those with a hot internal thermometer, the bottom opens to cool your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Shellie

customer_reviews.title: Slept out in basketball shorts and a t shirt in a hammock at 36F and was pretty toasty. I even had to unzip it a ...
customer_reviews.text: When the item arrived I was surprised at how compact it was. Some of the stitching was a bit loose but I think it will be ok. It is much warmer than expected. Slept out in basketball shorts and a t shirt in a hammock at 36F and was pretty toasty. I even had to unzip it a bit at one point. It's very lightweight and the most convenient bag I've ever owned. Perfect for backpacking and with a bivvy sack I'm sure you can probably sleep in -0.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Ultralight & Compact Design - Great for Backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Used for a couple of canoe trips - the bag is ultralight and compact, so it certainly serves the purpose for which I bought it. The weight is pretty comfortable for summer evenings, even if it cools off a bit. Works great for true backpacking trip. Outside of some weak stitching on the flap that’s meant to hold your camp pillow, the bag is pretty well made. We purchased three of them.
customer_reviews.author: BrewedInMN

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I tore the tag off like I do all my sleeping bags and cloth items, when I did the seam split, and it was clear it was going to keep running as the thread was now open, I could have cut the tag off but I like to get it all, it came off way to easy, by hand and with not a lot of force. I pulled the surrounding thread and it looked weak, I decided to sew it, it's now the strongest part of the bag I'm sure. company contacted me and is having a replacement sent before my trip. Good service
customer_reviews.author: C. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Easy to pack
customer_reviews.text: This packs down tight. I bought one for each of my kids for Christmas for a long future of backpacking and camping (and sleepovers). I hope they hold up. They stuff and don't need to be strategically folded first which is great. The elastic for attaching to a sleeping pad is nice. We haven't used them for camping yet but I hope to as soon as it's warm enough!
customer_reviews.author: Karin L Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great for claustrophobia
customer_reviews.text: Kept me warm when everyone else was cold. Camping in 30 degree weather in Oregon in October. Would definitely buy this again, as it’s great for people like me that hate feeling Claustrophobic in a tight sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gossett

customer_reviews.title: Awfully cold
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. I camped in 50 degree weather with this sleeping bag plus four top layers, two bottom layers, and an extra blanket and was absolutely freezing. My partner ended up waking up and warming me with his body heat (and better sleeping bag) because I was shivering so badly.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: You will survive but may not be warm.
customer_reviews.text: My son and I survived 5 nights in RMNP. Cold every night. Night time lows in the low 40s high 30s. Used an inflatable sleeping pad under, 2 pairs of socks, fleece pants and long sleeve shirt and woke up every morning freezing. Other reviews said the same thing but I was too cheap. Not a bad sleeping bag jut not for this cold at all. The description says "lower comfort limit of 29F-32F". I think their definition of comfort is a bit off...
customer_reviews.author: bseyd

customer_reviews.title: We took it out and were quite pleased with the material
customer_reviews.text: We took it out and were quite pleased with the material. The zipper did get caught if we were not careful. We are hoping our 8 year old grandson will take it easy on the zipper???? We were amazed that the sleeping bag did fit back into the sack! We were not able to completely tie the top but it was okay with us.
customer_reviews.author: Grams

customer_reviews.title: Great summer sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: If you like, you can simply copy and paste your feedback you just wrote to me: "Bought this to pack onto my motorcycle for a summer camping trip. I needed something that was compact as well as comfortable in heat- I'm traveling on a Honda Rebel 250 and camping in southern Indiana, so that's easier said than done. The price was incredible and I didn't wake up in a pool of sweat, even after sleeping in well past daybreak. I'll be ordering another for the significant other."
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bag at Great Price
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag was perfect for my July 4th camping trip with the family in the Catskills. Night temperature dropped to low 50's each night. Wearing light long sleeve t-shirt and sleep pants the bag kept me comfortable. Despite some negative reviews regarding the quality of the zipper I found there to be no problems with it. Overall construction of the bag exceeded my expectations and perfectly filled my need for a compact, lightweight summer bag. Rating it four stars solely due to the fact that I've only used this bag over one weekend so far.
customer_reviews.author: CYClop

customer_reviews.title: Best bag ever but I'd buy a different compression bag
customer_reviews.text: Love the sleeping bag it was warm and cozy and I got to let my fee out! I used to hate sleeping bags because I need my feet out of the covers and this sleeping bag is the solution!! I only gave it four out of five stars because the compression bag that came with mine didn't work at all wouldn't compress and then it fell apart.
customer_reviews.author: AJ04

customer_reviews.title: A good Fall/Spring bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bag for 40-50 degree nights. I had to pit some extra layers of clothes on to be comfortable sleeping in a tent when it was mid-thirties outside. It rolls up easily and weighs under 4lbs. Those are nice perks.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L.

customer_reviews.title: Good but lacking durability
customer_reviews.text: Very warm but haven't tested it for outdoor use just yet. Tried testing it's backabiliy and it definitely packs down to a nice size however one of the compression straps broke off on my first attemp. I love that it comes with pad straps though. I'm a beginner backpacker so was looking for something inexpensive however I am definitely questioning it's long-term durability
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Aragon

customer_reviews.title: BEST BAG EVER! - THE FOOT ZIPPER IS CLUTCH!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best non-ultralight sleeping bag I've ever owned. The feet zipper is clutch. The material is not hot, but still keeps you warm. Favorite sleeping bag ever and I'm used to buying name brand , super expensive bags. The pillow holder is a bit small for many blow up backpacking pillows, but you can use a jacket or clothing and it will make a great pillow! Love this thing!!
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Cozy
customer_reviews.text: I went on a camping trip in wymoning and this sleeping bag did a great job. At night it would get freezing cold but as long as I had this zipped up I felt nice and warm. Putting it away is also suuuuper easy since you just have to shove it inside the bag so I definitely love this sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made sleeping bag! I bought three of these for future camping with our young boys. So far, we've only "camped" in the living room, but the bags functionality is excellent. The zippers all flow freely and don't snag either zipping up or down. The stitching is all complete. Definitely a great product for the price. I'll update this review after a couple of camping trips and more use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: warm but light enough for Florida.
customer_reviews.text: This mummy bag is great at the price. I got it for my son in law,but grandson pronounced it his. He goes down for nap without being told to.
customer_reviews.author: Martie G

customer_reviews.title: Warm and the prefect size
customer_reviews.text: The smaller size is prefect for the smaller women. Will keep you warm on a cold night in the "High Sierra" mountains. 24 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton D Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Good Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: It worked great in my first camping trip with it. I can imagine it does good in colder weather but since I was camping in south Florida that was not needed. It was comfortable and easy to put away.
customer_reviews.author: Gabo08

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Love these sleeping bags so much that we've bought three of them. They are perfect for summer and early fall. Easy to pack and best of all, they don't take up much space. Definitely one of the best purchases we've ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Yara

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: So lightweight and compact, but comfy and cozy. We haven't used it for the typical camp out just yet but have made use of it for at home sleepover and have been very pleased. Purchased a 50 degree plus sleeping bag from Target by Embark, which was similar price, but bulky and the zipper got stuck many times. Will be returning that one ASAP and keeping our Outdoorsman Lab sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.author: Jungle Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality fabric, sewing and filling - I guess that is too be expected for the price. Returned this and purchased 2 Kelty bags that zip together. Kelty was twice the cost but 3-4 times the quality and longevity.
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

product_meta.title: Outdoorsman Lab Sleeping Bag for Adults and Kids - All Seasons Compact, Portable, Waterproof & Lightweight Camping Gear - for Backpacking, Hiking, Outdoor & Travel - with Compression Sack
feature_bullets: SIZED JUST RIGHT - Our ultralight 4-season cold weather sleeping bag packs down small for easy carrying and storage. It’s lightweight, compact, machine washable, and perfect for backpacking, hiking, camping, travel, or just lying under the stars in your backyard.

PERFECT 4-SEASON WARMTH – Chilly nighttime temps under the stars are no match for this camping must-have. An additional layer of fleece keeps you cozy while the drawstring hood covers your face and head for extra warmth.
DRYNESS & COMFORT – No need to “rough it”! This sleeping bag is a little luxury out in the wild. High loft synthetic filling and a breathable, soft lining keep you super comfortable.

LARGE ENOUGH FOR ADULTS & COZY FOR YOUNG ADULTS TOO! - The zipper foot box lets you stick your feet out for extra comfort and temperature control. Feet get hot at night? Let your feet breathe after a long hike with convenient end zip.

LIFETIME WARRANTY – Outdoorsman Lab sleeping bags for adults and kids include back straps to keep your sleeping pad in place, an integrated pillowcase for sleeping comfort, an inner zipper pocket to help keep your valuables safe, and is backed by a Lifetime Warranty!
